pageContext.claim: “These are manufacturing jobs that President Obama said will never happen. 'You'd need a magic wand. It's not going to happen.' Well, it's happening. We have the magic wand.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is misquoting Obama. The former president said in a June 2016 town hall, that "you're actually seeing some manufacturers coming back to the United States" but that alone won't help workers whose jobs had been previously outsourced and so "what we have to do is to make sure that folks are trained for the jobs that are coming in now." The "magic wand" referred to recreating jobs of the past through negotiating "a better deal."
